channel.title: Untitled Data Science Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Untitled Data Science Blog

item.title: Are Capitals the Biggest Cities in Each State?
item.description: h1 { text-align: center; } Setting the Stage My girlfriend and I were talking the other day about how weird it is that most American states seem to have capitals that are not their biggest city. Upon further discussion, I thought of big cities like Salt Lake City, Utah (where I live), that actually are the state capital and the biggest city. So we really wanted to know ‘are there more of the biggest cities in each state that aren’t the capital versus those that are?

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Hal Svien; I’m currently a product analyst in the financial tech industry. Check out the LinkedIn page on this site to see more about me and my work history. I have a master’s degree in psychology from Brigham Young University. I’m currently in the data science professional certificate through HarvardX. I use the blogdown package in R to create this site. You can find the Github repository link at the top of the page.

item.title: Welcome!
item.description: Hello, and thanks for visiting my blog! My name is Hal Svien; this is my data science blog where I’ll explore some data sets and answer questions that I find interesting. See the About section for more about me and my background, education, and my approach to this blog. I’ll include my citations with every post, and you’ll notice some come up frequently. I’ll end up using books by Scott Baldwin, Rex Kline, Neil Salkind, and Rebecca Warner because they are very elaborative, often giving examples from simulation data or the like to show you why what they’re discussing is accurate.

item.title: Contact
item.description: You can contact me a few different ways: halsvien@gmail.com, through LinkedIn or GitHub (linked at the top of this page) or really any other way you can find me.

item.title: CV
item.description: Check out my CV here. It is current as of July 2020.
